text: Thanks Huhzubendah for sharing the bottle! Poured into a taster into a hazy dull yellow with sparse white foam lacing. The nose shows lightly tart notes of tangerine, brett, and a light vanilla background. These notes are intense and juicy yet so beautifully composed together. The palate is medium bodied and moderately carbonated. Highly tart with refreshing flavors of bright and dry tangerine and light brett funk. No acetic edge but with light citrus notes. Finish is a resurgence of refreshing citrus and tangerine.

i>May 12, 2016. On tap at Hill Farmstead day at Warpigs. .
Cloudy yellow with a dense white head. Aroma is fruity and funky with lemon zest, orange, plum skins, green apple, oak, barnyard, brett and hay. 
Taste is tart, fruity with a light sweetness and funky. 
Light to medium bodied, soft to average carbonation. 
Finish is light sweet ripe plum notes, tart fruity notes of lemon, dry oak notes with some minerals, light earthy herbal notes. 
Great one!

Bottle shared with Jon and Paul. 

Sunshine yellow body, moderately hazy, small white collar. Aromas of brett, oak, wine, white grape. Plum character emerges more so in the flavor than the nose. Light and piquant. The finish brings sweet tart candies with a mild acetic note. Outstanding.

(On tap @ Warpigs HF Day, Copenhagen, May 12 2016) Pours a hazy pale pink-peach colour with a small white head and no lace. Aroma of rockets powder candy, lacto, slight sulphur, red plums, new oak and slight funk. Flavour is quite tart with more powder candy, red plum, light yoghurt, semi-sweet pale malt and fruit, fairly funky, with a light oaky dryness building into the finish. Mouthfeel is powdery and mineral with light carbonation. The powder candy association was amusing but not at all unpleasant, and the fruit was well-integrated with the character of the base beer here. Very nice feel in the mouth and balance, quite drinkable.
From tap. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, spice, fruit, acidic, tartness, grapefruit and plum.

Flora Plum batch 2

Pours a hazed peach pulp colored beer with a dense, stable head to it.

Has a floral barnyard characteristic on the nose, consisting of wet hay, wild flowers, fresh plugged mushrooms, lemon pulp, leather and in this case fruity, sour plums. The plums got an awesomly intriguing appearance on the nose, with a soft stone quality coming through, together with a sweeter note, resulting from the plum skin. 

Very silk on the tongue, this provides a soft, acidic driven plum richness from the start till the end, with a pleasant, fruity sweet note cutting through the tartness.

Tastes of hay and a stony mineral quality together with a lemony, funky tartness, revealing dust and leather, but also a flowery aspect. Plums get detectable once the initial, pungent tartness dies down by revealing an enjoyable, bright fruit pulp sweetness among prickly lemon and an aqueous softness. Finishes with more lemon, a late plum pulp sweetness and its initial flowery quality.

Comes well together with an enjoyable plum presence, bringing quite a few facetts to the foundation of the beer, without dominating the taste. Light bodied, very tart and aqueous during the finish.
Bottle. Hazy with a small white head that fades. Delicate plum fruit expression is amazingly in balance with wild yeast acidity. Nose and flavor exist in beautiful harmony. Happy Zwanze Day indeed.
Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares vol. ?. Light hazy amber pour with a small head. Notes of tart fruit, plums, some oily vanilla notes, funk, lingering tartness, citrus and some light tannins.

Pour from a bottle at Chris house - thanks again! Pours a super hazy dull old gold color with a pinkish tint and white head that settles into a ring. Lots of stone fruit here, with plum in particular, maybe some peach, lemon, yogurt, and loads of funk, as well. Light-medium bodied, with a tart, funky mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. Tasty stuff.

Bottle from Lukas and Bursprak. Pours hazy dark yellow with a white head. Aroma of soft juicy citrus fruits, funk, tropical notes, sweet white wine notes, plums and grapes. Extremely nice and complex aroma. Taste of plums, white wine, peach, grapes, funk, vinegar, juicy and pretty sour overall. This is bomb!

Bottle thanks to Lukasmh and bursprak. Pours hazy light milky orange with a small white head. Aromas of brett, plums, lactic, vinous, oaky, citrus, grapes. Taste is grapey, citrus, plums, lactic, vinous, oaky, lemony, citrussy, brett, peach.

From bottle thanks to Bursprak and LukasMH. A slight gusher. Pours a very hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma has quite a lot of hops, spicy yeast, plums, tart grapes, wine. Taste is tart, vinous, more grapes than plums, red grapes, dry finish. High carbonation and a smooth body.

Bottle @ Hill Farmstead. Was kind of dumb to spend as much money as we did on this, but oh well. YOLOONCE or something. Hazed pink tinted orange beer with white foam. There is a nice fruit quality to this, though its not necessarily a super strong plum character. Nice tart fruit, lemon juice, lemon zest, and funky yogurt. Really a nice funk to it, actually. Bright, tart, fruity, and overall enjoyable.

Poured from a bottle into a tulip: This is my favorite flora variant that Ive had. Pours pink with a thin head. Aroma of plums, other fruit, funk, tart, and oak. Taste is lots of fresh plum, dark fruit, medium to high tart. Soft mouthfeel and perfect carbonation, light to medium body.
Sample @ Hill Farmstead Tap Takeover, Warpigs. Light amber body with a small white head. Light hoppy, lemon, citrus, tart, plums. Sour finish.

Poured a lightly hazy light orange color with a white head. Aroma was of sweet tarts, light plum flesh, lemon juice, wheat. Flavor similar, reminded me pf a wicked weed beer with a very small amount of acetic acid from bullfrog. More spurthan expected.

Draught @ [ Hill Farmsted Tape Take Over ] - Warpigs Brewpub, Flaesketorvet 24, DK-1711 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Hill Farmstead Flora - Plum ].ABV: 5.0%. Unclear - hazy matt medium orange color with a small, fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate to heavy hoppy - yeasty, grapefruit, apricot, plum. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate acidic with a long duration, grapefrut, plum, apricot, yeast, hoppy, tart, dry. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft to flat. [20160512]

37,5 cl bottle @ home
Aroma is tart and even a bit sweaty(!) with grapefruit. Flavour is also rather tart with milky tones, grapefruit and some bretta-like earthy notes. Your typical bretta-saison; not exactly my thing but not bad either. Could not locate the plum but with this level of sourness I do not wonder why.
Bottle 0.375l at Laitis, Helsinki. Colour is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Dryness, wood, fruits, some sourness, Belgian yeast and malts. Very dry but enjoyable.

375 ml bottle. Thanks VastActiv! Batch 1.
Pours cloudy yellow color with a small head. Earthy and spicy aroma, yeast and some lemon tones, faint barnyard tones. Flavor is citrus and grapefruits, gooseberries and wooden tones. Extremely dry palate. Nice.
3446

375ml bottle, thanks VastActiv! Pours hazy yellowish orange with a smooth head. Aroma of juicy fruits, plum, tartish notes, hints of funky yeast and wood. Taste is dry, sourish and fruity with some hints of plums, tart notes, funky yeast and farmyard. Finish is tartish, sourish and funky with some earthiness, fruits, plum, bretta and wood. Pretty tasty, funky saison.

375 ml bottle. Pours a hazy yellow colour with a small foamy head. Aroma of fresh floral hops, some herbal notes and earthiness. Flavour of strong floral bitterness, plums, herbal notes, mild sweetness, gummybears and a bit of citrus. Medium bodied. Very refreshing. Awesome.

375 ml bottle to snifter. Looks good; a cloudy pale lemon with white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells yeasty and mildly funky alongside a mild plum presence. Tastes like it smells, but more tart, and the plum is more robust as well. Mouthfeel is medium-light to medium-bodied and pleasantly tart. Tasty.

Draft @ Warpigs Brewpub, Copenhagen. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity sour tart plum aroma. Fruity sour tart funky plum flavor. Has a fruity sour tart funky plum finish.

On tap at Warpigs. Cloudy pale golden with white head. Aroma is fruity, funk, biscuit, lemon, plums, hay, woody notes, brett and tart notes. Taste is tart, fruity, funky, bready biscuit notes,citrus and sour notes.

Bouteille 37.5cl de et partagée avec Pierre T. Big thanks for the generous share.
Dorée, léger paille-voile, col fin blanc. En comparant le tout avec la Quetsche, je note un niveau de couleur plus faible chez HF.
Arôme offre de belles effluves de prunes sans pour cela être trop dominant ces dernières tranchent bien avec un rétro-nasal de barrique rappelant le Chardonnay. 
Palais est léger, fleuri et finemetn fruité restituant bien le côté frais de prunes. Note aussi une certaine pointe de levure avec un côté un peu plus sauvage qui devient râpeux en fin de bouche. Niveau barrique, je note un boisé chêne tirant vers le vin blanc.

[5/12/16] Draught at Warpigs in Copenhagen. Cloudy pinkish orange. Lovely aroma, funky, fruity, oak. Tart flavor, funky, with fresh fruits, oak, cobwebs, and a bitterish touch in the finish. Medium-bodied. Wonderful and extremely refreshing.

Keg. Hazy yellow/orange with a small white head. Juicy sour nose with fruits, dust, hay, light baking yeast. Flavour follows. Juicy. Fruit, berries, hay, dust, wood. Medium body, low sweetness, medium sour. Crisp sour finish. Juicy as hell, very refreshing and pleasant to drink.

Keg @ WarPigs. Pours very hazy pale reddish yellow with a small creamy white head that leaves a small spotty trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity and funky with crackers, lemon juice, ripe green plums, yoghurt, hay, minerals, dry wood, barnyard and lemon zest. Taste is slightly sour, heavy fruity and funky. Mouthfeel is dry, tart, tiny sparkling and light bodied. Finish is sour, heavy fruity and slightly funky with bright plum fruitiness and suiting subtle funk. Simple and to the point with heavy juicy plum presence. Love it!

Murky peach color. Aroma has lots of fruits like quince, plum, apricot, pear and some lambic style funk but quite clean overall. Taste follows with the same fruits I got on the aroma. Not overly sour but it has a good amount of fruit acidity. Medium mouthfeel and carbonation. A really well done sour fruit beer resembling the lambic style.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Farmstead Day, Warpigs, Copenhagen (12/05/2016) - orange pour with white head. Plum fruity prominence, with a backing of grassy and floral notes, plumskin, medium acidic, brett, tart fruity finish.

Bottle (Batch 2) from trade. Unbelievable. Im struggling to find anything to fault about this beer. It smells incredible -- distinct, bright, funky notes come through from the wine barrel aging, mixing with the light fruit aroma of the plums. The appearance is fantastic, with a light pinkish color and a ton of clarity. Once you drink it, you notice an amazing drying sensation, like that first bite into a plum, when the tannins in the skin start drying out your mouth. Im droning on now (seriously, I just used the word "tannins"), but this beer is crazy good. Unbelievably well made. World class.

Tap @ Warpigs. Unclear peachy/yellow with tiny white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, brett, lemon, floral, peach and plum. Flavour is malt, fruit, brett, lemon, little sour, little dry, funky,plum, little sweet and a little bitter.

Keg at Warpigs on 12th May 2016. Pours a light hazy yellow/orange. Aroma is plum, mild lactics, tart fruits. Flavour is tart plums, some wood, bretty, mildly acetic. Mouthfeel is very dry and lip smacking.
user_location: The big bad LDN, Greater London, ENGLAND

text: On tap at Warpigs, pre-CBC. Hazy golden with no head. Quince, plums, peaches and farmhouse funk in the nose. Sour, with notes of lemons and peaches.

Draught @ Warpigs, Copenhagen. Pours hazy orange with an offwhite head. Aroma of sourness, light malt, yeast, hay, tart fruit, plum. Flavor is sour, yeast, tart fruit, plum, light citrus, grapes. Medium body, average to lively carbonation, light acidic finish. 120516

Sample at Warpigs during Hill Farmstead Day 2016. Hazy golden/orange beer with a small head. Tart plum flavor, floral, grapes, citrus, grassy earthy notes. Tart grass and plum flavor, citrus, floral notes, earthy, some acid.

Tap @Warpigs. My favorite HF saison out of the 5 I tried. Taste is so much plumb, light tart sourness, and so much plumb. Almost like a saison version of the Tilquin w/ plumb (but w/o carbonation). Extraordinary beer.
Tap at war pigs... Pink Amber... Thin white lacing.. Soft sweet pepper plum nose.. Tart puckering fruit.. Long soft funk.. Soft plum
Hazy pinkish, small white head. Aroma has sweet plumd and pear. Dry, slightly tart flavour, lots of fruit. Nice.
Pale cloudy blushing peach with a small pale head. Aroma is plum, peach, orange blossom. Light bodied, tangy on the palate with some great plum character. Taste is plum, peach, sour plum.
Pours cloudy ehite with minimal white head. Aroma is plum and bakewell tart pastry. Taste is plum sweet, plum tart, slight yeast sweet.
Tap at warpigs. Aroma of citrus, berries and vanilla. The Flavours is mainly sour but fruityness to it. Dry finish. Lingering acicity. The body is light and the texture is juicy. Great.

From tap at Warpigs, Hill Farmstead Day. It pours hazy peach like yellow. Creamy white head. The aroma is almost like the Danish desert Rødgrød. Vanilla and berries. Light acid. Sweet berries in the flavor along with a balancing acidic kick. Vanilla in the background. Awesome drinkabilily!
A: Cloudy peach coloured. N: Peach, plum, gooseberry, lemon T: yellow plum, nectarine, peach O: Very nice balanced between sweet and sour and great fruityness to it!

Pours rhubarb with minimal head 
Aromas of plums, vanilla sugar, wheat, sweet bread
Taste has notes of vanilla, plums, tart over ripe fruits , garden leaves

12.05.2016, tap @ Warpigs:
Small fizzy shortlasting head, slightly hazy. Aroma is rich and sweet sour-ish fruity, masses of plums, sorrel, plum stones, homemade canned plums syrup, canned peach. Taste is sour-ish fruity, soda powder, sorrel, sour plums, fruit stones, raw rhubarb, berry skin, minerals, sap. Medium bitterness, sour-ish dry mouthfeel, low carbonation. Nice one.

Pours light rhubarb with a very low white head. Aromas of citrus, plums, oak, honey, green apples. Taste is fruity and citrusy with a very pleasant oak notes. Mouthfeel is dry and tart yet quite smooth with moderate carbonation.
From tap. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is light earthy and wooden. Crisp sourish. Smooth fruity. Lingering dry towards wooden. Dry and citric far finish.
Tap @ Warpigs, tap take over. Hazy matt golden with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity and artificial. Flavor is medium sweet and light acidic. Dry and light acidic finish. 120516
Tap warpigs. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of funk, juicy, plums, tarty, barn. Taste is quite tarty, light sour, very fruity, grape fruit. Well balanced nice.
On tap at Warpigs. Hazy pale orange yellow with a small white head. Fruity aroma with some rather sharp vinegar. Dry and tart vinegar flavour with oak, grapefruit peel and fruit.

B1 bottle shared by a friend. poured a murky light amber-ish colour with a white ring on top. the aroma opens with a ton of plums!, bitter plum skin, pulp, wine barrel, barnyard flora funk, wheat, juicy plum juice, with still a base flora notice in the back. a real mouth watering aroma. taste follows the nose, plums, plums everywhere, earthy, citrus, lemon tartness, yeast, barnyard, sour, i think the plums also adds a slight extra tartness to it. amazing. mouthfeel mouthfeel is dry, with an perfect carbonation. awesome. this is very close to the original blueberry flora realy, such a delicate fruited version. loved it

37.5cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Very thin white head. Funky aroma. Cloudy blond pour. Tart afteraste with subtle plums

Bottle shared. Cloudy dull golden / light orange with a small white head. Aroma of tart plum, oak barrel, citrus, vinous notes, light lactic and tart fruity. Flavour is light moderate sour. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

375ml Bottle at Hill Farmstead tasting room, shared with no one. Pours a hazy light rosey/straw with a small head that laces. Aroma of citrus, straw with a deep funk. Very bacterial. Not specifically getting plums. Taste is tart and dry. Juicy and quenching acid. Finished with a beautiful pucker. Amazing.

Bottle pour at the brewery. Pours hazy golden with a pinkish hue and a white head. Aroma of the incredible base beer with a very nice blend of tartness, pale malts, wheat, plus the oak and wine and soft notes of plum. Flavor the same with a nice blend of everything. Nice light HF texture. A very good beer.

Bottle vintage 2015, sent by Tommy, and shared amongst friends. Appearance is cloudy yellow with plenty of white head. Aroma is lactic funk, acid, and ripe fruit. Taste is a punch of funk, with lemon zest, and refreshing crisp finish. I dont get the plum really but that might be a result of the age of the bottle. Either way this is world class stuff much more lactic funk then I was expecting.

375 mL bottle at the brewery, 3/18/16.Moderately hazy, soft golden-straw colored body is topped by an initially large, white head that steadily fades to cover.Very elegant aroma, much like regular flora though with perhaps a bit less soft funk and a touch more lactic and brett acids. The plum has been pretty well homogenized with the rest of the beer, and I certainly would be hard-pressed to pick it out blind. Soft wood and light honey notes behind the acids and fruitiness. As usual, much of what is great about this beer is what it lacks. For an American wild ale/sour, it doesnt have an acetic edge and the wood is reserved (no heavy oak). The malts are nicely attenuated and mostly sit in the background. No alcohol or flaw.In the flavor, its decidedly fruity, with light malt and plum sugars up front drying out heavily and leaving plum skin and lactic acid on the end. Brett acidity is fairly strong and the carbonation is mostly tight/engaging. Very enjoyable, easy-drinking stuff that isnt flashy or heavily sour. Still, I like the unadulterated funk of the regular Flora; the fruit doesnt really add much for me here.

Bottle, batch 1. Pale hazy golden pour with an off white head. Found this one quite acidic, unripe plum skins, tart, some yeast mixed in with oak, incredibly dry, and maybe its the age but compared to the other versions this one seemed to have become an enamel peeling beer - which is appealing to many people but not a huge things for me.

(Bouteille): Une arôme de prunes, de fleurs blanche, touche de miel et ce qui apparait être une fantastique acidité. En bouche, tout est superbement intégré, y compris laspect vineux. Le fruit appuie superbement la complexité de la Flora avec un léger soubresaut lactique/acétique dans la sécheresse exemplaire finale. Grand liquide.

375ml from trade with Hop Citizen. Drank to celebrate my son?s 3rd anniversary. Aroma: insanely good aroma of white wine, plum, apples, spices. This is quite oaky as well. Great! App: hazy unfiltered straw / salmon with small white head and beautiful lacing. Taste and palate: thin body, moderate carbonation, light sweetness, extremely dry and moderately acidity finish. Overall:   wow! This is pretty good! I enjoyed a lot this aroma. Almost gave goose bumps. By far the best Flora variant I?ve had. The white wine really shines here with the plums. I also really enjoyed the dryness a lot. Could be a tad less carbonated but this isn?t far from perfect. Great job again HF.

Pours a salmon pink with a finger of white foam. Nose is some juicy plum flesh, foggy rustic grain, some vinous plum skin sharpness. Palate follows with that classic morning dew softness that Flora always delivers with a nice round juicy plum body. The tannins from the skin add a nice little bite to the palate. Very tasty... but Id still take base Flora over all the delicious fruited versions so far !

Bottle split with Paul at Hills tasting room. Pours a bright murky orange body with thick white lace. Notes of indoor pool, fuzzy peach skins and tart fruit, sour white peaches, Madagascar vanilla bean, funk, tart oak and delicious juicy tart plum. Truly a special offering that hits the mark so hard.

A hazed blonde ale with a thin white head. In aroma, a beautiful tart fruity malt with loads of citrusy pulp, light tropical fruits, very nice. In mouth, ultra tart apples, light Brett, light lactic notes, very tart and refreshing.

Wow this is absolutely great. Straw peach color with quickly fading white head. Aroma is spectacular fleshy plum, farmhouse funk, oak, basement, and other fruits. Taste is pleasantly mid high tart with a jammy fruity sweetness that dries out on the finish. Palate does not suffer as badly as satsuma and bbr, the carb remains soft and nice unlike those other variants. Overall just great.

Dégustée à la brasserie en compagnie de Christian. Un liquide magnifique troublé par la levure, dune douce teinte de prune mi orange mi rose. Une jolie mousse blanche de grosses bulles, inhabituellement abondante pour une bière aussi acide, persiste de longues minutes. Le fond de levures dans un taster à côté de mon verre, je plonge mon nez dans cette coupe estivale. Un fabuleux équilibre entre la levure, le bois, le fruit... Un fruit frais et franc, malgré le fait que la prune est un fruit très subtile et délicat. Je sens le prunier à larrière de la maison de Saibt-Ours, mon village natale, lorsque larbre était en fleurs. La magie sarrête là pour moi. En bouche, lacidité me frappe avec trop de brutalité. Les flaveurs de fruits sont bien présentes mais passent malheureusement derrière cette attaque trop acide à mon goût. Mest avis quon fruit aussi délicat et fragile que la prune devrait être employé avec prudence. Ici, il passe malheureusement au second plan et ne sexprime quen fin de bouche. Un jus à déguster lété sur la terrasse.
Hazed yellow. Nice puffy white head. Nice tartness from the plums, citrusy and yeasty flavors. Good beer.

Pour is light golden orange with a thin white head. Nose is a bit phenolic, nice notes of plum, oak, peppery spice, and citrus. Flavor is much less phenolic and more plum forward, not sweet, lighter in flavor, hints of oak and vanilla, light acidity in the finish, strong carb, soft feel.
Bottle. Hazy golden pour with white head. Tart fruit, yeast, funky aromas. Sweet and tart fruit tones, plum and yeast tones.

Big thanks to Seth for the share. This is a really nice iteration of Flora with fruit in it, theres this little hint of fruity sweetness in the middle alongside a tartness and funk and lemony/grassy/wheaty character. Just a good, well-balanced, flavorful beer.

Poured from a bottle. 
Aroma is really nice and plum forward. Really great fruit notes with some light oak character and hints of tropical fruit and citrus. 
Pours a very hazy, cloudy, pale peach color with a small, thick white head that recedes to the edges where it lingers. Medium lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is fairly acidic with a hint of citrus. Fairly strong plum notes that work really well with the the acidity. Medium light bitterness and faint oak. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a great beer with a lot of fruit character. The plum works shockingly well, and better than a lot of other fruits. People should try using more plums in beer.

Bottle thanks to Vin! Pours hazy yellow-rose, small white head, good lacing. Aroma is cheesy as fuck, oak, Brett, some fruitiness. Flavor is light plus tart, mineral water, cheesy brett and delicate fruit. Medium body, effervescent and smooth. Solid.
Fruitiness on the nose, tart and dry, with a great bit of plum and stone fruit. So good.

375mL bottle, pours an opaque faded bleachy pinkish orange with a small white head. Aroma brings out fresh plums, medium acidity, and light funk. Flavour is remarkably well-integrated with the plums, perfect acidity, a touch of funk, and super juicy plums. Complex and superbly constructed. Phenomenal stuff.

Bottle @ Steve_0s HF party. Thanks a cloudy peachy yellow appearance with a white head. Spicy, bright plum, peppery, lemon, uber funky nose. Damn near perfect nose. Moderately tart. Not super complex flavor but its amazingly delicious. Nice carbonation. Unbelievable fruit. Best plum beer Ive had.

Bottle at my Hill Farmstead Tasting. Pour is murky orange with a small white head and good lacing. Huge plum aroma - somewhat tangy, lemony, biscuit, some dough, big white grapes, sweet tarts, urine, and funk. Taste is bug funky, acidic, sour lemons, lightly grassy, urine, horse blanket, plummy, tannic, white wine, and heavy oak with a big sour finish. Full mouthfeel with high carbonation. Really nice funky tones and wood notes - one of the best variations Ive had.
Bottle generously shared by Seth. Milky yellow pour with a white head. Muted sour bouquet. Tasty with loads of sour citrus/lemon with mellow plum lowlights. Really good. Nice body and mouthfeel.

500 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Hazy orange body. Very hazy. Not much of a head. Smells almost like apricot. Stone fruity aroma. White wine. Tastes lightly tart. The fruit flavor tastes a little bit more like plum, but heavily bent toward acidic stone fruit. Grainy wheat is very strong in the finish. Oak. Medium light body. Medium carbonation. Good stuff.
Bottle - Pours a cloudy white w/ yellow haze. Nose is sour, slight plum, wheaty. Taste is sour, tart, plum, lemons.
Bottle thanks to Rob. Pours a hazy gold with no head. The aroma is strong plum skin, funk, oak, wine. Thin mouth, tart plum, light acidity, funk, oak, juicy, really enjoyed this one.

yea had to do it, this is probably the best beer ive ever had. Who knew that plums would do it. Aroma is barnyard, wheat, grains, cherries, fruit, plum (obviously) and your standard flora base. 


Tons of extremely ripe dark stone fruit flavors, great wine barrel flavors. this is incredible. Again, thanks to Aaron. Cant thank you enough.

Bottle 375ml.
Pours slightly salmond blondish with minimla head/lacing. Aroma is of flowers, plums, fruits. Taste is of flowers, plums, some acidity, fruits, rustic yeast. Palate: Medium carbonation. Light body. Overall: Very nice. Good stuff. Refreshing acidity. Light. Nice rusticity.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2015 Bottle shared by Joe, pours hazy vibrant pink-golden color. Aromas of perfume florals, oak, and misc fruit. Ultra underripe plum and peach/apricot skin funk, dark grapes, sweet tarts and tons of lactic funk and complexity in the flavor. Medium bodied with salivating fruit finish. More sour than I expected. Really Tasty man, try dis funk

pours hazy cantaloup-pinkish with a small off-white cap, minimal retention and lacing. lightly tart apricots and other orchard fruitiness - yellow plums perhaps; light to medium acidity - complex microflora; citric fruits - cranberries, woodsy vanilla. light carbonation, light body, assertively tart - if not a bit sour - and fruity-spicy-citrusy finish. good - perhaps the best fruit flora to date.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2016 Bottle shared by czar, thanks bro! Pours a hazy peach juice-like/salmon with a thin white head that leaves low lacing. Nose is of fruits, acid and plums. Taste is pretty sour, a bit too much even, and full of plums over a lightly yeasty background. Incredibly refreshing but just a bit too extreme for my liking. Body is medium and carbonation too. Overall a nice fruit variation but I still prefer my Flora straight.

375 ml bottle thanks to T. j, much thanks. Cloudy pale gold color, thin spotty lace. Aroma is shows me mild, subtle plum juice, lime juice, dusty yeast and hints of a barnyard type hint.  the flavor is a carbon copy for the aroma. Lightly tart fruit, with a juicy type texture. The flavor is balanced between tartness and juicy fruit. Pretty good. Carbonation is soft with a lighter mouthfeel.
Poured from bottle hazy gold pour with white head. Aromas of fresh plum funk wine and earth. Taste is sour with notes of plum wheat and funk.
375mL bottle shared by Chalemeaux, thanks TJ! Pours pale golden beige. Aroma is bright citrus, farmhouse, plum. Super soft, with lemon, white grape, plum, a hint of oak.

Thanks TJ and Brian for sharing this bottle @ our little lake-house getaway.

A - Color is nice, a light yellow with pink hues, a 1 finger big finger solid white head. 

S - Smells like plums. its a nice aroma, pretty acidic, has a good fruit presence for sure.

T - Well, very sour. too sour for me but thats okay. lets push through. Tart, grape skins, wheat heavy with a tough of sweetness at the finish. I get all kinds of different plums with a really good plum presence particularly at the finish.

M - Thin, good overall carbonation and not overly carbed

O - Good beer. I think Blueberry is still a top for me but its pretty good.

Bottle (375 ml). Shared by czar, thanks!

Appearance: Slightly hazy bright pale yellow-golden with salmon reflects, a medium white head and good lacing. 

Aroma: Very similar to the "regular" Flora with bright winey notes and tartness along the HF bugs that theres now in most of their Saison, mild oak and eathy notes... but theres also a wonderful and delicate plum presence. 

Taste: Bright tartness along plums, bright winey notes, mild oak presence, light fruit sweetness, juicy, mild earthiness and very mild spiciness.

Palate: Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Winey mouthfeel. Moderately dry and tart finish. Mild lingering plum aftertaste. 

Overall: Its by far the best of the fruited Flora so far and my second favorite, only behind Flora b5, in all the Flora/Florence series. So delicate and drinkable while being incredibly complex and tasty. Flora is shining and the fruits are playing a perfect second violon role. Perfect balance. Its the first fruited version where the fruits compliments the Flora instead of hiding it. Amazing!

Bottle shared. Vibrant hazy gold pour with nice white head. Aroma is really nice flora with light fruity notes, fleshy plum aromas, light winey notes. Taste is sweet, fruity, very light acidity, super juicy and fresh. So light and bright, very tasty.

Bottle. Pours a hazy pink with light golden hues. Minimal eggshell head. Light lace. Aromas of wet oak, musty grape, under-ripe plums, light earth, light barnyard. Taste is incredible! A nice light balanced sour note hits with the fruit out of the gate. Nothing too overpowering, but prominent. Plum stays on the palate and provides a nice sweet middle ground where the soft mouthfeel and medium carbonation let wet oak and some barnyard notes move in. Finishes semi-dry, semi-sweet and semi-sour...just a wonderful harmony. My favorite of the fruited Floras so far!
Bottle. Need label. Pours peach gold. Nose and taste of sour plum, oak, sour funk, acidic funk and wine - medium body
